person.persName: John J. Thomas (Christian County, KY, farmer, soldier, politician, Provisional Congress of the Confederate States)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer, soldier, and politician. Virginia native. Married to Kate Thomas. Father of Lewis M. Thomas, John Q. Thomas, Pendleton Thomas, and Annie Thomas. Clerk in the United States Post Office in Washington, D.C. during the James K. Polk administration. Farmer in Christian County in 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860. Owned fifty enslaved persons in Christian County in 1860. Employed R. B. Cary as overseer in 1860. Served as a member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1851 to 1853. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Member of the Provisional Congress of the Confederate States from 1861 to 1862. Served as an aide to General John “Cerro Gordo” S. Williams in the Army of the Confederate States from 1862 to 1865.
